alert.note: Alert for Bell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 29 at 11:32AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Bell, Harlan and Knox. * WHEN...Until 230 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1132 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Barbourville, Harlan, Pineville, Middlesboro, Loyall, Evarts, Wallins Creek, Black Snake, Balkan, Blackmont, Callaway, Pathfork, Molus, Oaks, Cubage, Miracle, Stony Fork Junction, Varilla, Coldiron and Kettle Island.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
